thread.title: Man's body pulled from lake at university campus as horrified students look on - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Man's body pulled from lake at university campus as horrified students look on - Mirror Online

author: Josh Layton
title: Man's body pulled from lake at university campus as horrified students look on - Mirror Online
text:
Man's body pulled from lake at university campus as horrified students look on The man's body was found this afternoon at a University of Birmingham campus home to 3,500 students Share By Josh Layton Alison Stacey James Cartledge Chris Baynes 19:57, 21 FEB 2017 A man's body was found at the University of Birmingham today (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man's body has been pulled from a lake in front of shocked students at a university campus. 
Police sealed off an area at the University of Birmingham at about 3pm today after the man's body was found. 
A forensics team are examining the scene in The Vale campus, home to about 3,500 students. 
The body was wrapped in a white sheet and pulled from the water by officers at 6pm, as students watched on from a grass verge 60 metres away. 
West Midlands Police said the man had not yet been identified but is not believed to be a student or university employee. Read More Police cordoned off the lake at the University of Birmingham (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
Students at the campus, which also has a bar and restaurant, described the discovery as "scary". 
Dan Smith, 19, told the Birmingham Mail : "There were texts going round saying a body had been found in The Vale. 
“I didn’t know it was true until I saw the police cars and the flashing lights. 
“Stuff goes on all the time in Selly Oak but this is a quiet spot. 
“It’s quite creepy.” 
It is not yet clear how the man died or whether police are treating his death as suspicious. Read More Teacher who ran over a student 'prayed he had hit a bag', an inquest has heard The dead man is not believed to be a University of Birmingham student or employee (Photo: www.alamy.com) 
Another student said: "The police said a body had been found in the lake but they couldn’t be any more specific than that. 
“Apparently they did the forensics first and once that was done then they pulled the body out and took pictures of it. 
“It’s quite grim. 
“We have not been told if it is a student or not or if it is suspicious or not. 
“All we’ve been told is that students will receive information once police have finished their work at the scene.” 
Emily Harman, 18, added: "It’s quite scary, we usually feel so safe on The Vale. Some dodgy stuff does go on in Selly Oak but not here.” 
A West Midlands Police spokesman said: "Officers were called to a lake in Edgbaston Park Road just before 3.30pm today. 
“The body of the man remains at the scene while enquires are ongoing and has not been formally identified at this stage.“ Like us on Facebook
